function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Association of built environment attributes with the spread of COVID-19 in China","Impact":"Misunderstanding the causality may lead to ineffective mitigation strategies","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to establish causal relationships and identify effective mitigation strategies","Technologies":"Data analysis and modeling technologies, epidemiological studies","People":"Population of China, government agencies, public health organizations","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Infection clusters in less dense areas","Impact":"Increased spread of COVID-19 in areas with lower population density","Mitigation":"Implement targeted measures to address spread in less dense areas, such as increased testing and access to healthcare facilities","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, mobile testing units","People":"Residents of less dense areas, government agencies, public health organizations","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Differences in the associations of built environment attributes in different geographical locations","Impact":"Inconsistent effectiveness of mitigation strategies across different regions","Mitigation":"Tailor mitigation strategies to specific geographical locations based on local associations of built environment attributes","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis tools, data visualization, community engagement","People":"Population of different geographical locations, government agencies, public health organizations","Owner":"Government agencies, public health organizations"}]}
